data.enText: The punishment was harsh and unfair.

data.chText: 部长受到了严厉的批评。
data.enText: The minister received some harsh criticism .

data.chText: 他对自己的刻薄言辞感到后悔。
我们迟早都得正视生活的严酷现实。
data.enText: We had to face up to the harsh realities of life sooner or later.
very difficult and unpleasant to live in

data.chText: 寒冷的冬天；凛冽的风；恶劣的气候
那时大多数人所面对的艰苦境况
data.enText: the harsh conditions of poverty which existed for most people at that time
too strong and bright; ugly or unpleasant to look at

data.chText: 她遭到车前灯的强光照射。
data.enText: She was caught in the harsh glare of the headlights.

data.chText: 混凝土建筑物的粗陋线条
data.enText: the harsh lines of concrete buildings

data.chText: 粗糙的；毛糙的；刺激性强的
data.enText: too strong and rough and likely to damage sth

ex.enText: The general had a severe manner.

ex.chText: 我的老师对所有迟到的学生都同样严厉。
ex.enText: My teacher was equally severe on students who were late for class.

ex.chText: 首相对这场危机的处理受到了强烈批评。
ex.enText: The Prime Minister came under severe criticism for his handling of the crisis.

synonyms.bx: 形容人时指某人神态严肃的或待人处事要求严格、不讲情面的；形容事物时指法律、批评等异常严厉的，近乎苛刻。

ex.chText: 他是一个冷酷无情的人。
我没想到他会这么铁石心肠。
ex.enText: I had no idea he could be so cold-hearted.

synonyms.bx: 指人的举动令人觉得毫无怜悯之心的。

d: 冷酷无情的，铁石心肠的

ex.chText: 他父亲是个不讲情面的人。
ex.enText: His father was a hard man.

ex.chText: 她对待自己的助手太苛刻了。
ex.enText: She is too hard on her assistant.

synonyms.bx: 指对他人过分严厉的、苛刻的。

d: 冷酷无情的，严厉刻薄的

ex.chText: 他受到了同事们的严厉批评。
ex.enText: He suffered harsh criticism from his colleagues.

ex.chText: 昨天英语老师严厉责罚了他。
ex.enText: He received a harsh punishment from his English teacher yesterday.

ex.chText: 批评家对她的新著只有苛刻的批评。
ex.enText: The critics had nothing but harsh words for her new book.

synonyms.bx: 指对待他人或对他人的批评非常严厉的、苛刻的。

example: the harsh facts of court delays
a harsh and unlovable old tyrant
wild and harsh country full of hot sand and cactus
the nomad life is rough and hazardous
the harsh cry of a blue jay
the harsh white light makes you screw up your eyes
harsh irritating smoke filled the hallway

tr: of textures that are rough to the touch or substances consisting of relatively large particles

value.def: Harsh climates or conditions are very difficult for people, animals, and plants to live in.

example.ex: The weather grew harsh, chilly and unpredictable.
example.tran: 天气变得恶劣、寒冷且变化莫测。

example.ex: ...after the harsh experience of the war.
example.tran: 经历了严酷的战争之后

value.tran: （气候或条件）艰苦的，恶劣的，严峻的

value.def: Harsh actions or speech are unkind and show no understanding or sympathy.

example.ex: ...the cold, harsh cruelty of her husband...
example.tran: 她丈夫冷酷无情的残忍

example.ex: He said many harsh and unkind things about his opponents.
example.tran: 他以尖刻恶毒的语言大肆抨击自己的对手。

example.ex: She's been told that her husband is being harshly treated in prison...
example.tran: 她被告知自己的丈夫正在监狱里遭受虐待。

example.ex: 'Why didn't you tell me before?' asked Hunter harshly.
example.tran: “你为什么不早告诉我？”亨特厉声问道。

value.def: Something that is harsh is so hard, bright, or rough that it seems unpleasant or harmful.

example.ex: Tropical colours may look rather harsh in our dull northern light.
example.tran: 热带色彩在我们北方暗淡的光线下可能显得有点刺目。

example.ex: ...harsher detergents that can leave hair brittle.
example.tran: 会让发质变脆弱的刺激性较强的洗发水

example.ex: ...as the wine ages, losing its bitter harshness.

value.def: Harsh voices and sounds are ones that are rough and unpleasant to listen to.

example.ex: It's a pity she has such a loud harsh voice.
example.tran: 可惜她的嗓门太大太难听了。

example.ex: Then in a tone of abrupt harshness, he added, 'Open these trunks!'.
example.tran: 然后他又突然厉声说道，“把这些大箱子打开！”

value.def: If you talk about harsh realities or facts, or the harsh truth, you are emphasizing that they are true or real, although they are unpleasant and people try to avoid thinking about them.

example.ex: The harsh truth is that luck plays a big part in who will live or die.
example.tran: 残酷的事实是，谁死谁活在很大程度上要靠运气。
